input_sentence: the ego vehicle passes a stop line if the stop line is in front of the ego vehicle and is not in front of it at next time step.

atomic_propositions.description: Stop line is in front of ego vehicle
Ego vehicle passes the stop line

temporal_relations.description: If stop line is in front of ego and not in front at next time step, then ego passes the stop line

lexicon.stop_line_in_front: stop line is in front of ego vehicle
lexicon.ego_passes: ego vehicle passes the stop line

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_stop_line → stop_line

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(stop_line,ego) [predicate: in_front_of, object: stop_line, related_object: ego]
   - ap_2: passes(ego,stop_line) [predicate: passes, object: ego, related_object: stop_line]

3. Analyze temporal relations:
   - Antecedent: ap_1 & ~X(ap_1) → in_front_of(stop_line,ego) & ~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))
   - Consequent: ap_2 → passes(ego,stop_line)
   - Conditional relation: (in_front_of(stop_line,ego) & ~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))) -> passes(ego,stop_line)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
5. Metric constraint indicates discrete step semantics, so X operator is appropriate

Final MTL Formula:
G ((in_front_of(stop_line,ego) & ~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))) -> passes(ego,stop_line))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Parse objects list to build ID→name mapping:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_stop_line → stop_line

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: in_front_of(stop_line,ego) [predicate: in_front_of, object: stop_line, related_object: ego]
   - ap_2: passes(ego,stop_line) [predicate: passes, object: ego, related_object: stop_line]

3. Analyze temporal relations:
   - Antecedent: ap_1 & ~X(ap_1) → in_front_of(stop_line,ego) & ~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))
   - Consequent: ap_2 → passes(ego,stop_line)
   - Conditional relation: (in_front_of(stop_line,ego) & ~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))) -> passes(ego,stop_line)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
5. Metric constraint indicates discrete step semantics, so X operator is appropriate

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula uses the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" applies to the entire implication.
- The antecedent contains a relational predicate `in_front_of(stop_line,ego)`, which translates to "the stop line is in front of the ego vehicle".
- The `~X(in_front_of(stop_line,ego))` means "in the next step, the stop line is not in front of the ego vehicle", indicating a change in spatial relationship.
- The conjunction `&` combines these two conditions into a single triggering scenario.
- The consequent uses the predicate `passes(ego,stop_line)`, meaning "the ego vehicle passes the stop line".
- The implication `->` indicates that whenever the antecedent condition holds, the consequent must occur.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the stop line is in front of the ego vehicle and in the next step it is no longer in front of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must have passed the stop line.

- The conjunction `&` combines these two conditions into a single triggering scenario.
- The consequent uses the predicate `passes(ego,stop_line)`, meaning "the ego vehicle passes the stop line".

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
